question.title: What is the primary reason for not starting probabilistic antibiotic therapy before sampling in suspected spondylodiscitis?
question.description: In the event of suspected disco-vertebral infection, urgent hospital management for diagnostic confirmation (imaging), microbiological documentation and treatment to limit the risk of complications. No probabilistic antibiotic therapy before sampling to avoid delaying therapeutic treatment

option_a.title: To prevent the spread of infection to other parts of the body
option_a.description: This option is plausible but incorrect, as the primary concern is not to prevent the spread of infection, but to avoid delaying therapeutic treatment

option_b.title: To allow for more accurate diagnosis through imaging
option_b.description: This option is also plausible, but the correct answer is not related to imaging, but to the timing of antibiotic therapy

option_c.title: To minimize the risk of complications and ensure prompt treatment
option_c.description: This option is correct, as the primary reason for not starting probabilistic antibiotic therapy before sampling is to avoid delaying therapeutic treatment

option_d.title: To reduce the risk of antibiotic resistance
option_d.description: This option is plausible, but not the primary reason for not starting probabilistic antibiotic therapy before sampling

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
